result.execSummary:
The defendant David James Lewer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs paid in full. Bond previously posted in the amount of $1000 has been applied.
The Court orders forfeiture and destruction of the seized HI-Point Model C9 9mm Luger.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David James Lewer

records.addlTxt: CK#14078 excess bond refunded to poster N.M. se

Case called @ 3:36 PM Defendant David James Lewer appeared by phone.  Attorney Erik C. Johnson in court for David James Lewer.  Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives his right to be personally present in the courtroom. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: NC. 22TR83 - NC.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. 22TR84 - DRI. 22TR592 - Dismissed outright. No statement by DE. Court orders: 22CM9 - Costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, the Court orders forfeiture and destruction of the seized HI-Point Model C9 9mm Luger.  22TR83 - $225 forfeiture plus costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, $42.50 Blood Draw fee w/ 60 DTP or PP, 8 mo DL revocation, 12 month IID, OWI Assessment. Appeal rights given. Bond previously posted to be applied.

Plea/sentencing hearing on August 23, 2022 at 10:45 am.
